text:
Do y’all knew about this cool project: <https://github.com/heliosdrm/GRUtils.jl> Making GR Julian.
I think this could be the answer for Julia’s first time to plot problem. I think this is a great relief if your package requires plotting capabilities.

elements.text: Do y’all knew about this cool project:

Making GR Julian.
I think this could be the answer for Julia’s first time to plot problem. I think this is a great relief if your package requires plotting capabilities.

text: I'm not quite sure what this changes with regards to the current situation, could you explain?

elements.text: I'm not quite sure what this changes with regards to the current situation, could you explain?

text:
It wraps GR.
It is a nice wrapper for GR.
A bit nicer than using GR.jl directly.

It does indeed load faster than Plots.jl in my limited experience.
(Plots.jl also wraps GR and a bunch of other backends)

But GRUtils has no RecipesBase support.

elements.text:
It wraps GR.
It is a nice wrapper for GR.
A bit nicer than using GR.jl directly.

It does indeed load faster than Plots.jl in my limited experience.
(Plots.jl also wraps GR and a bunch of other backends)

text: Well, if you don't care about Recipes you can already use GR.jl and have almost instant plots, no?

elements.text: Well, if you don't care about Recipes you can already use GR.jl and have almost instant plots, no?

text: Yeah, but GRUtils is a bit nicer.

elements.text: Yeah, but GRUtils is a bit nicer.

text: GRUtils is the only way I’ve found to easily plot a histogram with log-scaling bins (it’s just `xlog=true`). Admittedly, I contributed a fix to get that working right, but it was still easier to do that than anything else! (Looking forward to when Makie gets log axes though).
